NOMBRE: Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist
DESCRIPCION: The OpportunityWe’re looking for a Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist to help us push the boundaries of what education can offer through the power of technology. Education is our passion and our team members bring that to work each day as they aim to advance learning in every region of the world. Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company providing dynamic products and services to the global education community. We’re focused on driving innovation in EdTech and working with our clients to create a smarter learning environment.For more information about Blackboard Inc. and our career opportunities please visit .Blackboard’s Global Demand and Digital Marketing team tell the story of Blackboard to the education community through multi-channel digital campaigns and Blackboard.com. The team partners across marketing and the entire organization to bring the Blackboard message to our audience in the digital space.As a Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist you will report to the Global Marketing Campaigns Manager and be responsible for building and executing campaigns using our marketing automation platform. You’ll play a pivotal role in the execution and analysis of campaigns at the global and regional level. Working closely with field marketing and other members of the demand center you will manage the production and roll-out of marketing campaigns ensuring they are deployed according to plan and on time.Specific Responsibilities Will IncludeManaging the day-to-day alignment and coordination of campaign development between the Global Demand and Digital Marketing team and other members of Blackboard’s Marketing organization such as Field Marketing Client Engagement and Global EventsBuilding and executing marketing campaigns using our marketing automation tool; production tasks will include but are not limited to emails landing pages forms segments and campaign logicWorking with field marketing to produce test and launch campaign subject to approvalWorking independently as well as with the campaign owners in the team to ensure project plans get executed including deadlines and SLA compliance specs assets budget vendor coordination status updates approvals and final deliveryEnsuring all campaign collateral is delivered in line with brand guidelines (per Corporate Marketing guides)Tracking progress of campaigns once live and reporting on campaign impactOptimizing and standardizing program implementation processes across the organization contributing to the development of standard campaign build processes and best practices; collecting and sharing feedback on improvements to the campaign production processSupporting manager in promoting and delivering training on new campaign developmentsBecoming fluent in the marketplace dynamics client segment needs roles personas and helping develop and execute scalable marketing activities based on this client-centric and segmented approachThe CandidateRequired skills/qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing Communications or Business or equivalent work experience3+ years of related marketing experience preferably in an international environment and marketing agency experienceDemonstrated experience in building campaigns using marketing automation tools and executing projects of varying complexityAbility to effectively prioritize multiple projects and manage results while maintaining flexibilityStrong marketing and/or communications experience with the ability to plan and implement a strategic integrated marketing approachHands-on collaborative and a can-do attitudeSelf-sufficient and proactive in solving problemsExtensive knowledge of Marketing Automation tools preferably EloquaAdvanced knowledge of HTML and CSSGood knowledge of digital marketing UTM tracking and goal conversion tracking and email and landing page best practices preferably including Google Analytics and Google Tag ManagerGood knowledge of project management methodologiesPreferred Skills/qualificationsProject Management certificationKnowledge of JavaScript codingThe OfficeBlackboard has an office located in Bogota Colombia as a hub for the LAC market.Located in Capital Towers center in the financial district Excellent and secure area to eat lunch have a walk or dine after office hours Benefits in prepaid medicine Easy access to public transportation close to two important avenues Carrera 7 and Calle 100 Free bike parking for employees and paid bike parking for visitors Multiple private spaces for virtual and face-to-face meetings Regular events like bring your dog to work day and ping-pong foosball and Mario Kart tournaments Sodexo card provided for employees Learn more about the Bogota office culture by checking out our page Please submit CV/resume in English. DESCRIPCION: En British American Tobacco somos líderes en el mercado una organización global con una larga trayectoria y un futuro brillante y dinámico. Gracias a nuestra gente continuamos generando crecimiento y superando las expectativas en un mercado cada vez más complejo y desafiante.Si tienes el talento y la motivación para ayudarnos a lograr el éxito descubrirás que también estamos comprometidos a ayudarte a alcanzar tu máximo potencial.Quieres que tus practicas universitarias sean retadoras y con impacto al negocio? Únete a BAT Colombia! Desarrolla y fortalece tus habilidades de liderazgo para que hagas parte de la #NextGen de líderes!Haz parte de la agenda de transformación de BAT Colombia. NOMBRE: Remote Insides Sales Representative
DESCRIPCION: This position requires a Native level of English. Please submit your resume in English  Resumes that are not in English will not be considered.  Hojas de vida que no esten en ingles no seran consideradas Position OverviewThe B2B Sales Representative helps to generate and facilitate sales for a company by supporting the sales team. In the capacity as front line representative to the sales team the B2B is involved in initiating contact with potential customers through phone calls known as outbound prospecting/cold-calling. It's common for the BDR to communicate with potential customers by phone and by email The objective is to identify the potential needs of the customer qualify their interest and viability and create a relationship that will help drive the sale.Key Duties And Responsibilities Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities  Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails  Present our company to potential clients  Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services  Customize product solutions to increase customer satisfaction  Build long-term trusting relationships with clients  Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market  Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) clients and Account Executives  Report to the Business Development Manager on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results Qualifications Proven work experience (1-year minimum) as a Business Development Representative Sales Account Executive or similar role  Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls) Track record of achieving sales quotas  Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce) Familiarity with MS Excel (analyzing spreadsheets and charts) Understanding of sales performance metrics  Exc ellent communication and negotiation skills  Ability to deliver engaging presentations  BS degree in Marketing Business Administration or relevant field  Key competencies  Accountability  Coachability  Adaptability  Prior Success  Curiosity  Communication  Active Listening Benefits And Perks40 hrs per week  Office hours- No weekends 7 Days Paid Time Off (PTO)  Major U.S. Federal Holidays ObservedMostrar másMostrar menos

NOMBRE: Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist
DESCRIPCION: The OpportunityWe’re looking for a Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist to help us push the boundaries of what education can offer through the power of technology. Education is our passion and our team members bring that to work each day as they aim to advance learning in every region of the world. Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company providing dynamic products and services to the global education community. We’re focused on driving innovation in EdTech and working with our clients to create a smarter learning environment.For more information about Blackboard Inc. and our career opportunities please visit .Blackboard’s Global Demand and Digital Marketing team tell the story of Blackboard to the education community through multi-channel digital campaigns and Blackboard.com. The team partners across marketing and the entire organization to bring the Blackboard message to our audience in the digital space.As a Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist you will report to the Global Marketing Campaigns Manager and be responsible for building and executing campaigns using our marketing automation platform. You’ll play a pivotal role in the execution and analysis of campaigns at the global and regional level. Working closely with field marketing and other members of the demand center you will manage the production and roll-out of marketing campaigns ensuring they are deployed according to plan and on time.Specific Responsibilities Will IncludeManaging the day-to-day alignment and coordination of campaign development between the Global Demand and Digital Marketing team and other members of Blackboard’s Marketing organization such as Field Marketing Client Engagement and Global EventsBuilding and executing marketing campaigns using our marketing automation tool; production tasks will include but are not limited to emails landing pages forms segments and campaign logicWorking with field marketing to produce test and launch campaign subject to approvalWorking independently as well as with the campaign owners in the team to ensure project plans get executed including deadlines and SLA compliance specs assets budget vendor coordination status updates approvals and final deliveryEnsuring all campaign collateral is delivered in line with brand guidelines (per Corporate Marketing guides)Tracking progress of campaigns once live and reporting on campaign impactOptimizing and standardizing program implementation processes across the organization contributing to the development of standard campaign build processes and best practices; collecting and sharing feedback on improvements to the campaign production processSupporting manager in promoting and delivering training on new campaign developmentsBecoming fluent in the marketplace dynamics client segment needs roles personas and helping develop and execute scalable marketing activities based on this client-centric and segmented approachThe CandidateRequired skills/qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing Communications or Business or equivalent work experience3+ years of related marketing experience preferably in an international environment and marketing agency experienceDemonstrated experience in building campaigns using marketing automation tools and executing projects of varying complexityAbility to effectively prioritize multiple projects and manage results while maintaining flexibilityStrong marketing and/or communications experience with the ability to plan and implement a strategic integrated marketing approachHands-on collaborative and a can-do attitudeSelf-sufficient and proactive in solving problemsExtensive knowledge of Marketing Automation tools preferably EloquaAdvanced knowledge of HTML and CSSGood knowledge of digital marketing UTM tracking and goal conversion tracking and email and landing page best practices preferably including Google Analytics and Google Tag ManagerGood knowledge of project management methodologiesPreferred Skills/qualificationsProject Management certificationKnowledge of JavaScript codingThe OfficeBlackboard has an office located in Bogota Colombia as a hub for the LAC market.Located in Capital Towers center in the financial district Excellent and secure area to eat lunch have a walk or dine after office hours Benefits in prepaid medicine Easy access to public transportation close to two important avenues Carrera 7 and Calle 100 Free bike parking for employees and paid bike parking for visitors Multiple private spaces for virtual and face-to-face meetings Regular events like bring your dog to work day and ping-pong foosball and Mario Kart tournaments Sodexo card provided for employees Learn more about the Bogota office culture by checking out our page Please submit CV/resume in English. Only applications submitted in English will be considered.This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities duties or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.  Blackboard Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race gender age color religion national origin marital status disability sexual orientation protected military/veteran status or any other protected factor.Location/Division: Bogota Colombia Job Requisition: BB-3357Mostrar másMostrar menos

NOMBRE: Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist
DESCRIPCION: The OpportunityWe’re looking for a Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist to help us push the boundaries of what education can offer through the power of technology. Education is our passion and our team members bring that to work each day as they aim to advance learning in every region of the world. Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company providing dynamic products and services to the global education community. We’re focused on driving innovation in EdTech and working with our clients to create a smarter learning environment.For more information about Blackboard Inc. and our career opportunities please visit .Blackboard’s Global Demand and Digital Marketing team tell the story of Blackboard to the education community through multi-channel digital campaigns and Blackboard.com. The team partners across marketing and the entire organization to bring the Blackboard message to our audience in the digital space.As a Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist you will report to the Global Marketing Campaigns Manager and be responsible for building and executing campaigns using our marketing automation platform. You’ll play a pivotal role in the execution and analysis of campaigns at the global and regional level. Working closely with field marketing and other members of the demand center you will manage the production and roll-out of marketing campaigns ensuring they are deployed according to plan and on time.Specific Responsibilities Will IncludeManaging the day-to-day alignment and coordination of campaign development between the Global Demand and Digital Marketing team and other members of Blackboard’s Marketing organization such as Field Marketing Client Engagement and Global EventsBuilding and executing marketing campaigns using our marketing automation tool; production tasks will include but are not limited to emails landing pages forms segments and campaign logicWorking with field marketing to produce test and launch campaign subject to approvalWorking independently as well as with the campaign owners in the team to ensure project plans get executed including deadlines and SLA compliance specs assets budget vendor coordination status updates approvals and final deliveryEnsuring all campaign collateral is delivered in line with brand guidelines (per Corporate Marketing guides)Tracking progress of campaigns once live and reporting on campaign impactOptimizing and standardizing program implementation processes across the organization contributing to the development of standard campaign build processes and best practices; collecting and sharing feedback on improvements to the campaign production processSupporting manager in promoting and delivering training on new campaign developmentsBecoming fluent in the marketplace dynamics client segment needs roles personas and helping develop and execute scalable marketing activities based on this client-centric and segmented approachThe CandidateRequired skills/qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing Communications or Business or equivalent work experience3+ years of related marketing experience preferably in an international environment and marketing agency experienceDemonstrated experience in building campaigns using marketing automation tools and executing projects of varying complexityAbility to effectively prioritize multiple projects and manage results while maintaining flexibilityStrong marketing and/or communications experience with the ability to plan and implement a strategic integrated marketing approachHands-on collaborative and a can-do attitudeSelf-sufficient and proactive in solving problemsExtensive knowledge of Marketing Automation tools preferably EloquaAdvanced knowledge of HTML and CSSGood knowledge of digital marketing UTM tracking and goal conversion tracking and email and landing page best practices preferably including Google Analytics and Google Tag ManagerGood knowledge of project management methodologiesPreferred Skills/qualificationsProject Management certificationKnowledge of JavaScript codingThe OfficeBlackboard has an office located in Bogota Colombia as a hub for the LAC market.Located in Capital Towers center in the financial district Excellent and secure area to eat lunch have a walk or dine after office hours Benefits in prepaid medicine Easy access to public transportation close to two important avenues Carrera 7 and Calle 100 Free bike parking for employees and paid bike parking for visitors Multiple private spaces for virtual and face-to-face meetings Regular events like bring your dog to work day and ping-pong foosball and Mario Kart tournaments Sodexo card provided for employees Learn more about the Bogota office culture by checking out our page Please submit CV/resume in English. Only applications submitted in English will be considered.This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities duties or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time. Con más de 1300 empleados trabajando en proyectos alrededor del mundo, un crecimiento anual sostenido de más del 50%, y reconocida por Inc. en el Top 10 de empresas privadas de mayor crecimiento de Silicon Valley, BairesDev se ha posicionado como referente en la industria del software, impulsando la transformación digital de algunas de las empresas más importantes en el mundo, como Google, Rolls-Royce, Pinterest, EY, SiriusXM, Motorola, ViacomCBS y Chime.Reconocida por Clutch co como una Compañía Top de Servicios Tecnológicos B2B, BairesDev cuenta con oficinas en Estados Unidos, Canadá, Europa y América Latina y ofrece un entorno de trabajo excepcional donde sus empleados pueden destacarse como profesionales, desarrollándose en equipos multiculturales con horarios flexibles y múltiples oportunidades de crecimiento.  BairesDev tiene como misión ofrecer servicios personalizados de desarrollo de software reconocidos por su excelencia a nivel mundial. La empresa contrata únicamente al Top 1% del Talento del mercado con el objetivo de crear equipos sólidos que ofrezcan soluciones tecnológicas de principio a fin. Prepárate para trabajar en escenarios dinámicos con líderes en la industria y en proyectos altamente innovadores!Buscamos Client Marketing Specialist para sumarse al equipo de Marketing y participar en distintos proyectos conformados por equipos multiculturales distribuidos en todo el mundo. Buscamos personas proactivas, dinámicas y team players, con gran capacidad de organización, acostumbradas a manejar múltiples tareas y con marcada atención al detalle. Se trata de una excelente oportunidad para aquellos profesionales que busquen desarrollarse en una de las empresas con mayor crecimiento de la industria!Principales responsabilidades:- Escribir colaterales de mercadotecnia, incluyendo credenciales, propuestas y presentaciones de eventos.- Proporcionar al equipo de ventas contenido original que incluya estudios de casos, publicaciones de blog, infografías, videos y documentos técnicos.- Coordinar la apariencia de manera consistente entre nuestros materiales de marketing y colaterales.- Supervisar proveedores internos y externos para garantizar entregas a tiempo y de calidad.- Comprender las necesidades de nuestros clientes y ayudar al equipo de ventas a mejorar la comunicación con nuestros clientes y posibles clientes.- Centrarse en el éxito y el crecimiento de nuestros clientes existentes.- Educar a nuestros equipos internos y a nuestros clientes sobre nuestros servicios.¿Qué Buscamos?- Un mínimo de 5 años de experiencia previa en roles de venta consultiva.- Graduados de carreras de comercialización, marketing o afines.- Nivel de inglés bilingüe.¿Qué Ofrecemos?- Excelente plan de compensación, muy por encima de la media del mercado.- Posibilidad de trabajo remoto y con horarios flexibles.- Planes de capacitación.- Amplias posibilidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional gracias a nuestro sistema de mentorship.Si está interesado en formar parte de un equipo compuesto por los mejores profesionales y trabajar 100% orientado a objetivos en un entorno innovador, pero con la estructura y los recursos de un líder de mercado multinacional, ¡no dude en postularse!

LafargeHolcim is the leader in the building materials industry with more than 100 years of experience and presence in over 80 countries. Transformational spirit will be an essential part of the ADC DNA. ADC will be an agile organization where value creation will be continuously re-imagined. We are intensely customer-focused (both internal and external), and seek to meet diverse needs across the entire customer life cycle. ADC is looking for a Sales and Marketing SD Functional Specialist, who will work to define requirements, design, and develop complex solutions and processes for Sales and Distribution applications within the ADC application platform.  Supporting the Sales and Marketing Leader, the role will consider usability, cost, and speed to market while ensuring the features meet the requirements of the business customer.  The incumbent will become a stakeholder and expert for the overall design of the Sales and Distribution application landscape, as well as approves all functional design documents, after complete and full review.Key Strategic ObjectivesFacilitate and lead in-depth workshops to elicit review and confirm business requirements, business process reengineering, data and workflows, business models, business rules and user interface design. Quickly sketch a complex design concept and estimate effort based on business requirements. Provide technical support to regional and global initiatives and projects.Design and develop applications that ensure compliance with Group internal control procedures and security policy.Oversee all Sales and Distribution configuration and development. Approves all Sales and Distribution functional design documents, after complete and full review.Qualifications:University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related discipline Salesforce Certification preferredSAP Certification in SD is desired (ECC at least) Required Experience:Minimum 6 years experience in SAP SD Module design, development, configuration and support of technology solutions to support SAP O2C business processesDesired Experience:Experience in Command Concrete, Command Batch and Apex solutionsExperience in Salesforce.com solutionExperience in ABAP DevelopmentRequired skills:Maintain a high level of awareness of all current SAP applications and solutions.Keen understanding of key concepts and technologies related to integrating SAP with 3rd party software and middleware technologies.Proficient understanding of overall O2C business application landscape and integration.Highly experienced with configuration of SAP SD and LE. Experience with interfaces in SAP ECC (Proxies, IDOCs, Flat files, etc.). Experience with SOQL (Salesforce Object Query Language).Able to evaluate project complexity, constraints, risks and dependencies and effectively relay suitable information to key stakeholders. Understanding of IT service delivery and IT Service Management concepts and procedures.Languages:Fluent English (min B2) and Spanish required (written & spoken)Benefits3 full extralegal bonuses (complete primas) through the year (paid in June, December and each anniversary in ADC).Annual performance bonus with a maximum amount of 1.5 monthly salary. Flex weekly scheduled. 12 free half days per year. Extra vacation days by tenure.Laptop given to the employee after 3 years in the company.66% of prepaid medicine. Life insurance (fully paid)Work from home scheme.Free snacks and beverages at the office.Grocery bonus.

DESCRIPCION: The OpportunityWe’re looking for a Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist to help us push the boundaries of what education can offer through the power of technology. Education is our passion and our team members bring that to work each day as they aim to advance learning in every region of the world. Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company providing dynamic products and services to the global education community. We’re focused on driving innovation in EdTech and working with our clients to create a smarter learning environment.For more information about Blackboard Inc. and our career opportunities please visit .Blackboard’s Global Demand and Digital Marketing team tell the story of Blackboard to the education community through multi-channel digital campaigns and Blackboard.com. The team partners across marketing and the entire organization to bring the Blackboard message to our audience in the digital space.As a Marketing Automation Campaigns Specialist you will report to the Global Marketing Campaigns Manager and be responsible for building and executing campaigns using our marketing automation platform. You’ll play a pivotal role in the execution and analysis of campaigns at the global and regional level. Working closely with field marketing and other members of the demand center you will manage the production and roll-out of marketing campaigns ensuring they are deployed according to plan and on time.Specific Responsibilities Will IncludeManaging the day-to-day alignment and coordination of campaign development between the Global Demand and Digital Marketing team and other members of Blackboard’s Marketing organization such as Field Marketing Client Engagement and Global EventsBuilding and executing marketing campaigns using our marketing automation tool; production tasks will include but are not limited to emails landing pages forms segments and campaign logicWorking with field marketing to produce test and launch campaign subject to approvalWorking independently as well as with the campaign owners in the team to ensure project plans get executed including deadlines and SLA compliance specs assets budget vendor coordination status updates approvals and final deliveryEnsuring all campaign collateral is delivered in line with brand guidelines (per Corporate Marketing guides)Tracking progress of campaigns once live and reporting on campaign impactOptimizing and standardizing program implementation processes across the organization contributing to the development of standard campaign build processes and best practices; collecting and sharing feedback on improvements to the campaign production processSupporting manager in promoting and delivering training on new campaign developmentsBecoming fluent in the marketplace dynamics client segment needs roles personas and helping develop and execute scalable marketing activities based on this client-centric and segmented approachThe CandidateRequired skills/qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing Communications or Business or equivalent work experience3+ years of related marketing experience preferably in an international environment and marketing agency experienceDemonstrated experience in building campaigns using marketing automation tools and executing projects of varying complexityAbility to effectively prioritize multiple projects and manage results while maintaining flexibilityStrong marketing and/or communications experience with the ability to plan and implement a strategic integrated marketing approachHands-on collaborative and a can-do attitudeSelf-sufficient and proactive in solving problemsExtensive knowledge of Marketing Automation tools preferably EloquaAdvanced knowledge of HTML and CSSGood knowledge of digital marketing UTM tracking and goal conversion tracking and email and landing page best practices preferably including Google Analytics and Google Tag ManagerGood knowledge of project management methodologiesPreferred Skills/qualificationsProject Management certificationKnowledge of JavaScript codingThe OfficeBlackboard has an office located in Bogota Colombia as a hub for the LAC market.Located in Capital Towers center in the financial district Excellent and secure area to eat lunch have a walk or dine after office hours Benefits in prepaid medicine Easy access to public transportation close to two important avenues Carrera 7 and Calle 100 Free bike parking for employees and paid bike parking for visitors Multiple private spaces for virtual and face-to-face meetings Regular events like bring your dog to Gracias a nuestra gente continuamos generando crecimiento y superando las expectativas en un mercado cada vez más complejo y desafiante.Si tienes el talento y la motivación para ayudarnos a lograr el éxito descubrirás que también estamos comprometidos a ayudarte a alcanzar tu máximo potencial.Quieres que tus practicas universitarias sean retadoras y con impacto al negocio? Únete a BAT Colombia! Desarrolla y fortalece tus habilidades de liderazgo para que hagas parte de la #NextGen de líderes!Haz parte de la agenda de transformación de BAT Colombia. Únete a nuestro programa de Internship aprende y disfruta de grandes retos!Principales Funciones Soportar a los ejecutivos del negocio. Apoyo en la comunicaciones del área. Inglés avanzado (oral y escrito) Microsoft Office intermedio o avanzado (power point Excel) Sólidas habilidades de comunicaciónBritish American Tobacco es una de las compañías multinacionales líder con marcas vendidas en más de 200 mercados hechos en 44 fábricas en 42 países.Estamos orgullosos de estar consistentemente dentro de las 5 compañías de la Bolsa de Valores de Londres.Nuestro portafolio incluye nuestras mundialmente famosas marcas - Dunhill Kent Lucky Strike Pall Mall y Rothmans - junto con muchas marcas líderes internacionales tales como Vogue Peter Stuyvesant y State Express 555.De la mano con nuestro negocio tradicional de tabaco también desarrollamos productos que le dan a los consumidores menos riesgos alternativos a los cigarros regulares. Nuestra nueva generación de productos ya está liderando el camino en la industria del vapor y dispositivos de calentamiento de tabaco.Continuamos dearrollando un portafolio sólido de soluciones al consumidor que ya incluyen marcas globalmente conocidas como Vype Glo and Voke.Mostrar másMostrar menos

NOMBRE: SAP PS Functional Specialist
DESCRIPCION: Americas Digital Center (ADC) is a new company of the LafargeHolcim Group that will provide Digital and Technology services for 10 countries in 2 regions. LafargeHolcim is the leader in the building materials industry with more than 100 years of experience and presence in over 80 countries. Transformational spirit will be an essential part of the ADC DNA. ADC will be an agile organization where value creation will be continuously re-imagined. We are intensely customer-focused (both internal and external) and seek to meet diverse needs across the entire customer life cycle. ADC is looking for an SAP PS Functional Specialist who will work to define requirements design and develop complex solutions and processes for Manufacturing applications within the ADC  application platform.  Supporting the Technical Leader - Manufacturing Systems the role will consider usability cost and speed to market while ensuring the features meet the requirements of the business customer. The main activities for this position will be:● Align IT solutions to the goals of LafargeHolcim’s lines of business.● Work directly with the business to define requirements and propose solutions.● Contribute to the improvement of business processes.● Proactively offer solutions and enhancements which leverage best practices while managing enterprise expectations.● Consider all requirements business process reengineering data and workflows business models business rules and user interface design. ● Leading collaborative design discussions with key stakeholders across IT and business to ensure design is consistent accurate flexible and scalable.● Responsible for providing expertise and approvals during the development phase test planning and ensure solutions meet the overall design requirements for the application landscape.● Following all established design standards and suggesting improvements when they are needed.● Providing technical support to regional and global initiatives and projects.● Design and develop applications that ensure compliance with Group internal control procedures and security policy.● Provide technical support for all SAP Manufacturing applications.● Provide support to other colleagues in terms of technical/functional expertise with the assigned business processes.● Oversee all Manufacturing configuration and development for SAP Applications.● Approves all technical functional design documents after complete and full review.Qualifications:● University degree in Computer Science Engineering Information Systems or related discipline● SAP PS PP PM or PPM Certification is desired.● Plus: ITIL Service Management Certification is desired. Required Experience:● At least 6 years of experience in SAP PS application development configuration and support of technology solutions. Languages:● Fluent English (min B2) and Spanish required (written & spoken)Benefits● 3 full extralegal bonuses (complete primas) through the year (paid in June December and each anniversary in ADC).● Annual performance bonus with a maximum amount of 1.5 monthly salary.●Flex weekly scheduled. 12 free half days per year. Extra vacation days by tenure.● Laptop given to the employee after 3 years in the company.● 66% of prepaid medicine. Life insurance (fully paid)● Work from home scheme.● Free snacks and beverages at the office.● Grocery bonus.Mostrar másMostrar menos

NOMBRE: Regional Health Systems Advisor - Valle del Cauca LHSS
DESCRIPCION: Organization OverviewThe International Development Division focuses on improving the lives and economic well-being of people in lower and middle-income countries. We command technical expertise in health agriculture climate change food security and governance—as well as in international evaluation. Our multi-layered health portfolio includes policy health promotion and disease prevention health finance and health systems management. In partnership with government clients and local experts our high-quality programs in Africa Asia Latin America and the Middle East are known for impact and innovation.Job SummaryAbt Associates seeks a qualified Regional Health Systems Advisor for the USAID-funded Local Health System Sustainability(LHSS)[1] Colombia Activity. This Activity will support the Government of Colombia (GOC)’s efforts to achieve a financially sustainable integration of Venezuelan migrants into the Colombian health system. To this end LHSS will provide assistance to strengthen the governance and implementation capacity to all levels of the health system to respond to the health needs of migrants and receptor communities support the government to develop new mechanisms to sustainably finance health services for migrants as part of their integration into the health system and provide assistance so that the migrant’s receptor communities have access to quality health care. The four main objectives of this activity are to provide assistance to the Ministry of Health of Colombia (MSPS) to: 1) strengthen governance and implementation capacity to respond to the needs of migrants and receptor communities; 2) sustainably finance the provision of health services for migrants and receptor communities; 3) increase access to high quality appropriate health care services for migrants and receptor communities; and 4) strengthen the health system to respond to current and future shocks including the COVID-19 pandemic.The LHSS Colombia Activity will be a 4 year program based in Bogota Colombia with other territorial offices. The Regional Health Systems Advisor will be based in Valle del Cauca.Key Roles And ResponsibilitiesThe Regional Health Systems Advisor will have the following specific duties and responsibilities:  Manage the LHSS Colombia Activity’s relationship with the local territorial entities in Valle del Cauca including departmental and municipal health secretariats   Oversee and coordinate the implementation of the LHSS Colombia interventions in Valle del Cauca leading in areas including performance management budgeting and managing local subcontractors and partners   Work with counterparts in USAID other development partners MSPS officials in Valle del Cauca public and private health providers and other stakeholders to achieve a coordinated response and to integrate migrants into the health system   Manage and supervise the LHSS staff in Valle del Cauca and ensure a cohesive and productive team dynamic in the regional office   Under the guidance of MSPS support LHSS Colombia leads in the design and implementation of interventions on governance and policy health financing and service delivery in Valle del Cauca;   Communicate regularly with the central LHSS Colombia office and regional health entities to stay apprised of the migrant healthcare situation   Contribute to LHSS MEL activities including developing indicators collecting data and reporting on indicators in collaboration with the MEL team   Regularly report intervention status to the LHSS Colombia Deputy Chief of party and work with the Deputy Chief of Party to revise implementation plans as necessary to ensure best possible completion of interventions   Support the Activity’s MEL and Communications teams to develop case studies and success stories from LHSS Colombia interventions   Attend relevant meetings technical working groups conferences etc. to share knowledge generated through LHSS interventions  Within the LHSS project the Regional Health Systems Advisor will be supported by LHSS home office-based operations finance and technical expertise and will report to the LHSS Colombia Activity Deputy Chief of Party.Preferred Qualifications  Master’s degree or higher in management public policy international development public health or a related field is required. A focus in a public health or health management-related discipline is preferred.   Minimum 6 years’ prior experience implementing governance activities in the public and/or private sectors is required. Experience implementing health system strengthening activities and/or integrating health care for vulnerable populations is desirable.   Demonstrated knowledge of the Colombian health sector   Knowledge of Valle del Cauca and experience working with the departmental or municipal governments is preferred   Demonstrated experience with international development and donor-funded programs. Familiarity with USAID-funded projects will be an advantage   Fluent Spanish writing/speaking skills required; English skills are an advantage   Colombian nationals are encouraged to apply  Minimum Qualifications  (6+) years of experience and a master degree OR the equivalent combination of education and experience  [1] Local Health System Sustainability (LHSS) was previously titled Achieving Sustainability through Local Health Systems (ASLHS).Descripción del EmpleoCargo: Asesor Regional de Sistemas de Salud – Valle del CaucaOportunidadAbt Associates busca un Asesor Regional de Sistemas de Salud para el proyecto financiado por USAID Sostenibilidad de los sistemas locales de salud (LHSS por sus siglas en inglés)[1] en Colombia. Este proyecto apoyará los esfuerzos del Gobierno de Colombia orientados a lograr una integración sostenible de los migrantes venezolanos al sistema de salud colombiano. Con este fin el proyecto LHSS brindará asistencia para fortalecer la capacidad de gobernanza e implementación en todos los niveles del sistema de salud para responder a las necesidades de salud de los migrantes y de las comunidades receptoras; apoyará al gobierno en el desarrollo de nuevos mecanismos para financiar de forma sostenible los servicios de salud para los migrantes como parte de su integración al sistema de salud; y proveerá asistencia para que las comunidades receptoras de los migrantes tengan acceso a una atención de salud de calidad.Los cuatro objetivos principales de esta actividad son brindar asistencia al Ministerio de Salud y Protección Social de Colombia (MSPS) con el fin de: 1) fortalecer la capacidad de gobernanza e implementación para responder a las necesidades de los migrantes y las comunidades receptoras; 2) financiar de forma sostenible la provisión de servicios de salud a los migrantes y las comunidades receptoras; 3) incrementar el acceso a servicios de atención de salud adecuados de alta calidad para migrantes y comunidades receptoras; y 4) fortalecer al sistema de salud para responder a crisis de salud pública actuales y futuras como la pandemia de COVID-19.La actividad del proyecto LHSS en Colombia tendrá una duración de 4 años con base en Bogotá Colombia considerándose además oficinas departamentales. El Asesor Regional de Sistemas de Salud será basado en Valle del Cauca.Funciones y Responsabilidades Principales El Asesor Regional de Sistemas de Salud tendrá las siguientes funciones y responsabilidades:  Gestionar la relación de la actividad de LHSS en Colombia con las entidades territoriales locales en Valle del Cauca incluyendo secretarias departamentales y municipales   Supervisar y coordinar la implementación de los componentes de LHSS en Colombia en Valle del Cauca liderando en áreas que incluyen la gestión del rendimiento el presupuesto y la gestión de subcontratistas y socios locales   Trabajar con homólogos en USAID otros socios que trabajan en el desarrollo internacional MSPS funcionarios en Valle del Cauca proveedores públicos y privados y otros actores para lograr una respuesta coordinada e integrar los migrantes en el sistema de salud   Gestionar y supervisar al personal del proyecto LHSS en Valle del Cauca y asegurar una dinámica de equipo coherente y productivo en la oficina regional   Bajo la orientación del MSPS apoyar a los jefes de los componentes de LHSS en el diseño e implementación de componentes sobre gobernanza y políticas financiamiento de salud y prestación de servicios en Valle del Cauca   Comunicarse regularmente con la oficina central del proyecto LHSS Colombia y las entidades de salud subnacionales para mantenerse informado sobre la situación de salud de los migrantes.   Contribuir en las actividades de monitoreo evaluación y aprendizaje (MEL por sus siglas en inglés) del LHSS incluyendo indicadores de desarrollo recopilación de datos e informes sobre indicadores en colaboración con el equipo de MEL   Informar regularmente al Director adjunto del proyecto LHSS Colombia sobre el estado de los componentes y trabajar con el Director adjunto del proyecto examinando los planes de implementación según sea necesario asegurando el mejor cumplimiento posible de las actividades   Apoyar a los equipos de MEL y de Comunicaciones del proyecto en el desarrollo de estudios de casos e historias de éxito de las actividades del LHSS en Colombia   Asistir a las reuniones o conferencias relevantes participar con grupos de trabajo técnico etc. para compartir el conocimiento logrado en las actividades del LHSS  Dentro del proyecto LHSS el Asesor Regional de Sistemas de Salud de salud contará con el respaldo de la experiencia técnica financiera y de operaciones de la oficina sede del LHSS y será supervisado por el Director adjunto de la actividad del proyecto LHSS Colombia. Calificaciones Preferidas   Se requiere maestría o un título más alto en gerencia políticas públicas desarrollo internacional salud pública u otro campo relacionado. Preferiblemente contar con un enfoque en salud pública o una disciplina relacionada a administración en salud.   Se requiere mínimo seis años de experiencia previa implementando actividades de gobernanza en el sector publico y/o el sector privado. Experiencia implementando actividades de fortalecimiento de sistemas de salud y/o integrando atención para poblaciones vulnerables es deseable.   Conocimiento demostrable del sector de salud colombiano   Conocimiento de Valle del Cauca y experiencia trabajando con gobiernos departamentales o municipales es preferible   Experiencia demostrable con programas de desarrollo internacional y programas financiados por donantes. Familiaridad con proyectos financiados por la USAID es una ventaja   Se requiere dominio del español tanto escrito como hablado; dominio del inglés es una ventaja   Los ciudadanos colombianos especialmente aquellos que se encuentran viviendo dentro del país están invitados a postularse para este cargo   Elegibilidad Mínima   (6+) años de experiencia y una maestría O la combinación equivalente de educación y experiencia  [1] El proyecto de Sostenibilidad de los sistemas locales de salud (LHSS) se denominaba anteriormente como Lograr la sostenibilidad mediante los sistemas locales de salud (ASLHS).Abt Associates is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse workforce. Abt Associates provides market-competitive salaries and comprehensive employee benefits. Local candidates strongly encouraged to apply.Disclaimer: Abt Associates will never ask candidates for money in exchange for an offer of employment.Abt Associates es un empleador de oportunidades igualitarias y acción positiva comprometido a fomentar la fuerza laboral diversa. Abt Associates ofrece salarios competitivos en el mercado y beneficios integrales a los empleados.Mostrar másMostrar menos

DESCRIPCION: The OpportunityWe’re looking for a Manager Network Operations to help us push the boundaries of what education can offer through the power of technology. Education is our passion and our team members bring that to work each day as they aim to advance learning in every region of the world.
